result.execSummary:
The defendant David B. Schoenborn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

Atty Lloyd present via video. 
ADA Kurczewski present via video. 
Parties are prepared to proceed. 
Statements by ADA Kurcsewski regarding conviction and sentencing in Waukesha County case 18CF1700. 
Atty Lloyd stipulates to conviction. 
Defendant waives his right to appear in person today. 
Recommendations by counsel. 
Statements by defendant. 
Statements by the Court. 
Count 1 not to be addressed by the Court today. 
On Count 5 defendant sentenced to DOC for 7 years;  3 years initial confinement followed by 4 years extended supervision. 
Sentence is concurrent to any other sentence, except is consecutive to Jail sentence in Count 1. 
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incareration and Substance Abuse programs. 
Bad time explained by the Court.

- pay costs/supervision fees 
- no contact directly or indirectly with Larry Foster, Stephanie Brandt, Tina King, Crystal Kalwitz or Koeppen Medical Transport
